alert.note: Alert for Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 18 at 7:20PM EDT until April 21 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following county, Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 717 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen from the earlier thunderstorms. Light to moderate rains will continue to slowly dissipate through early this evening over the advisory area which can produce another quarter to half an inch of rainfall on top of the already rains that fell over this area. These rainfall amounts could cause minor flooding on secondary roads. Therefore, the Flood Advisory remains in effect until 845 PM EDT this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Homestead, Homestead General Airport, The Redland, Homestead Miami Speedway, Florida City, Royal Palm Ranger, Leisure City, Naranja, Richmond West, Princeton, Country Walk, Homestead Base, The Hammocks, Everglades National Park and Inlikita. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
